meanings.definition: To imitate the style of someone or something in order to make fun of them.
meanings.sent1: The students parodied their teacher's accent during the school play.
meanings.sent2: She parodied the famous singer's dance moves in her comedy routine.
meanings.sent3: The comedian parodied the president's speeches, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: His impression of a robot parodied the idea of artificial intelligence.
meanings.sent5: The actor's exaggerated gestures parodied the character's personality perfectly.

meanings.definition: A humorous or satirical imitation of a person or work.
meanings.sent1: The parody of the movie was a big hit at the comedy club.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a hilarious parody of the popular song for the talent show.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon featured a funny parody of a famous painting.
meanings.sent4: The play was a clever parody of a well-known Shakespearean tragedy.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's parody of the celebrity was spot-on and had the audience in stitches.
